Package com.deco2800.game.components.maingame

Class PopupUIHandler

java.lang.Object
com.deco2800.game.components.maingame.PopupUIHandler
public class PopupUIHandler
extends java.lang.Object
Handles setting up the UI for the win, loss and pause menus. One PopupUIHandler is created for a pop-up menu. This class allows for the visuals on the pop-up menus to be easily modified or changed

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructor for the PopupUIHandler

  • Constructor Details

    • PopupUIHandler

      public PopupUIHandler​(java.lang.String[] textures)
      Constructor for the PopupUIHandler
      Parameters:
      textures - the textures to be used on the menu. Must be ordered as: 1: the background texture of the menu 2: the buttons you would like to use on the menu, in order of their appearance

  • Method Details

    • setupBackground

      public Image setupBackground​(Table backgroundFrame)
      Places the background texture of the menu onto the menu.
      Parameters:
      backgroundFrame - the Table holding the image for the background
      Returns:
      the background image

    • setupButtons

      public java.util.ArrayList<Image> setupButtons​(Table buttonHolder, float upperPadding, float betweenPadding, boolean lose)
      Creates the buttons for the pop-up menu, and places them on the background in order
      Parameters:
      buttonHolder - the Table holding the buttons for the menu
      upperPadding - the amount of padding to put above the uppermost button. This will vary depending on the spacing you want on your background, or how large the background header text is.
      betweenPadding - the amount of padding to put between each individual button (starting beneath the uppermost button). This will vary depending on how close together you would like your buttons to be.
      Returns:
      a list of the buttons to which actions will be added

    • addButtons

      public void addButtons​(Table buttonHolder, java.util.ArrayList<Image> buttons, float betweenPadding)
      Adds the buttons to the pop-up menu.
      Parameters:
      buttonHolder - the Table holding the buttons for the menu
      buttons - the buttons to be added to the menu
      betweenPadding - the amount of padding to put between the buttons on the menu

    • setupButtonClicks

      public void setupButtonClicks​(java.util.ArrayList<Image> buttons, java.lang.String[] actions, Entity entity)
      Handles setting up the on-click actions for the buttons on the menu.
      Parameters:
      buttons - the buttons which are on the menu, in order of appearance
      actions - the events to trigger when the particular button is pressed. Must be in the same order as the buttons placement on the menu itself.
      entity - the entity on which Action classes are listening for push-button events.

    • getBackground

      public java.lang.String getBackground()
      Retrieve the filepath for the current UI background.
      Returns:
      the filepath for the background

    • getButtons

      public java.lang.String[] getButtons()
      Retrieve the file paths for the current UI buttons
      Returns:
      a string array holding the file paths for the buttons
